content.prompt: During the 1960s, sit-in demonstrations were first effectively used by

choices.label: college students working with the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC) and the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP)
Martin Luther King, Jr., and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC)
Malcolm X and the Nation of Islam
African American veterans returning from the Second World War

topic.text: 8.10: The African American Civil Rights Movement (1960s)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
